pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:5.1: 34. The training rule on not getting an attendant
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:6.2: At that time a disciple of the nun Thullanandā was suffering, but she neither attended on her nor made any effort to get someone else to attend on her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:7.3: “How could Venerable Thullanandā not attend on a sick student, nor get anyone to attend on her?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā acted like this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:7.7: How can the nun Thullanandā not attend on a sick student, nor get anyone to attend on her?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:8.1: ‘If a nun does not attend on a sick student, nor makes any effort to get someone else to attend on her, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:11.2: a pupil is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:12.2: does not herself attend on her.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:13.1: Nor makes any effort to get someone else to attend on her:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:13.2: she does not ask anyone else.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:14.1: If she thinks, “I will not attend on her, nor will I make any effort to get anyone else to attend on her,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:14.2: If she does not attend, nor makes any effort to get anyone else to attend, on a disciple or one who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:15.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:16.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
